topics.body:
-Leader of the Nationalist Party, Modi, is poised to win Indian elections
-His province, Gujarat, is one of the most prosperous and safe in India (most improved I believe)

-Spain under Franco had low wages, almost no taxes, strikes were forbidden and very few regulations
-It was called the "Spanish Miracle" as it was the fastest growing economy in the world after Japan

-Buenos Aires is an extremely European city
-same goes for the cities in Lebanon under Christian rule

-Uruguay is 90% white, more so than a lot of Western Europe.
-Uruguay used to be very laissez faire and was a great place to live
-Uruguay has since suffered a fascist dictatorship and several socialist governments and now the young are trying to leave

-Che Guevara beheaded homosexuals and was extremely racist.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/536addfe63687241e2140000#post_536addfe63687241e2140000

That's why I like people in general (with obvious exceptions...)

Yeah, we screw it up every single time. But I prefer to believe in the potential on the long run because just giving up is easy and I refuse to take the easy route on that regard.

I'm an optimistic and idealistic idiot, and I trust more in Rosseau even if Hobbs has pretty solid arguments
